title: Symbolic Differentiation
description: Computes the derivative of an expression with respect to a variable using symbolic mathematics

examples.title: Power Rule
examples.explanation: Demonstrates differentiation of polynomial expressions using the power rule

code.python:
from mathhook import expr, symbol
x = symbol('x')
f = expr('x^3')
derivative = f.derivative(x, 1)
assert derivative == expr('3*x^2')

examples.title: Chain Rule
examples.explanation: Demonstrates differentiation of composite functions using the chain rule

examples.title: Product Rule
examples.explanation: Demonstrates differentiation of products using the product rule

code.python:
f = expr('x*sin(x)')
derivative = f.derivative(x, 1)
# Returns: sin(x) + x*cos(x)

use_cases: Physics: Calculate velocity and acceleration from position functions
Economics: Find marginal cost and revenue functions
Engineering: Optimize designs by finding critical points
Machine Learning: Compute gradients for backpropagation

performance.complexity: O(n) where n is the number of nodes in the expression tree

seo.meta_description: Compute symbolic derivatives with MathHook's powerful CAS. Supports chain rule, product rule, power rule. Fast, accurate, and easy to use for Rust, Python, and JavaScript.
seo.og_title: Symbolic Differentiation - MathHook Computer Algebra System
seo.og_description: Professional-grade symbolic differentiation library. Calculate derivatives symbolically with support for chain rule, product rule, and more. Available for Rust, Python, and JavaScript.
